components.description: A component that displays important messages, warnings, or errors to users, typically with different visual styles to indicate severity levels.
A clickable text element that navigates users to another location, either within the same page or to an external resource.
A target location for navigation within a page.
A floating panel that appears anchored to a specific element, typically used for contextual menus, tooltips, or popovers that need to maintain a visual connection to their trigger element.

A container component that maintains a specific width-to-height ratio for its content, ensuring consistent proportions across different screen sizes and preventing layout shifts during content loading.
A circular or rounded component that displays a user's profile picture, initials, or a placeholder icon to represent a person or entity.
A collection of avatar components displayed together, often with overlapping or stacked layouts to represent groups of users, team members, or related entities.
A small visual indicator that displays a number, status, or label, often used to show counts, states, or highlight important information.
A prominent display component that spans the width of its container, typically used for marketing messages, announcements, or brand-related content with high visual impact.
A component that visually distinguishes quoted text from regular content, often with special styling, indentation, or decorative elements to highlight important statements or testimonials.
A component that simulates a book or document interface, allowing users to navigate through pages or sections with realistic page-turning animations and layout.
A navigation component that shows the current page's location within a website's hierarchy, allowing users to understand their position and navigate back to previous levels.
An interactive element that triggers an action when clicked, available in various styles and sizes to indicate different levels of importance and functionality.
A container that groups related buttons together, providing visual and functional organization for multiple actions, with options for different layouts and interaction patterns.
A component that displays dates in a grid format, allowing users to view, select, and interact with dates, often including features for event display and date range selection.
A security component that verifies human users through challenges like image recognition, text input, or puzzle solving, helping prevent automated bot interactions.
A container component that groups related content and actions together, often with a visual boundary and optional header, footer, or interactive elements.
A component that displays a series of content items (images, cards, or other elements) in a rotating sequence, with navigation controls to move between items.
A form control that allows users to select one or multiple options from a set of choices, typically displayed as a square box that can be checked or unchecked.
A contextual help component that highlights and explains interface elements through visual overlays and tooltips, guiding users through new features or complex interactions.
A component that displays formatted code with syntax highlighting, line numbers, and optional copy functionality, typically used for documentation or code examples.
A specialized input component that allows users to select colors through various interfaces like color wheels, sliders, or swatches, with support for different color formats.
A combination of a text input and dropdown menu that allows users to either select from predefined options or enter custom values, with filtering and search capabilities.
A menu that appears in response to user interaction (like right-click or long-press), displaying contextually relevant actions and options for the selected element.
A component that displays and manages numerical values, allowing users to increment or decrement a count through buttons or input, with options for minimum and maximum limits.
A specialized input component that handles currency conversion, allowing users to input amounts in one currency and view equivalent values in other currencies with real-time updates.
A component that presents data in visual formats like charts, graphs, or diagrams, making complex information more accessible and understandable through visual representation.
A specialized input component that allows users to select dates through a calendar interface, with support for date ranges, time selection, and various date formats.
A component that allows users to expand and collapse content sections, typically with a visible summary and hidden details that can be toggled on demand.
A floating window that appears over the main content to present information, gather user input, or confirm actions, often with a semi-transparent backdrop.
A component that provides definitions, translations, or explanations for terms, often with search functionality and categorization to help users understand specialized vocabulary.
A component that reveals additional information or content when activated, typically through a button or trigger, helping to manage information density and focus user attention.
A visual element that creates separation between content sections, available in various styles like lines, spaces, or decorative elements to improve content organization and readability.
A component that presents best practices and common mistakes in a structured format, using visual indicators to clearly distinguish between recommended and discouraged actions.
A component that initiates file downloads, providing information about file size, type, and download progress, with options for different file formats and download methods.
A panel that slides in from the edge of the screen, typically used for navigation, settings, or additional content, with options for different positions and interaction patterns.
A component that provides a rich text editing interface, allowing users to create and modify content with formatting options, media embedding, and real-time collaboration features.
A component that displays when there is no data or content to show, providing guidance, illustrations, or actions to help users understand and resolve the empty state.
A container component that groups related form controls together, providing visual organization and semantic structure for complex forms with multiple input fields.
A component that displays metadata and information about a file, including name, size, type, last modified date, and preview options, with actions for file management.
A component that allows users to select and upload files, supporting drag-and-drop interactions, file type validation, and progress indicators for the upload process.
A component that allows users to refine and narrow down content or data based on specific criteria, often with multiple filter options and real-time filtering capabilities.
A small visual indicator that draws attention to specific content or states, often using color, icons, or text to highlight important information or status changes.
A component that visualizes a sequence of events or steps in a process, typically using a horizontal or vertical line with connected nodes to show progression and relationships.
A visual indicator that shows which element currently has keyboard focus, helping users navigate the interface and maintain accessibility standards for keyboard-only users.
A component that appears at the bottom of a page or section, typically containing navigation links, copyright information, and supplementary content organized in a structured layout.
A component that displays a measurement or progress using a circular or semi-circular indicator, often with color coding and numerical values to show current status or performance.
A rating component that uses a globe or circular visualization to represent scores or ratings, with options for different rating scales and visual styles to indicate quality or performance.
A layout component that organizes content into rows and columns, providing a flexible and responsive structure for arranging interface elements in a consistent and visually balanced way.
A component that appears at the top of a page or section, typically containing navigation, branding, and key actions, with options for different styles and responsive behaviors.
A prominent display component that spans the full width of the viewport, typically used for key marketing messages, featured content, or important announcements with high visual impact.
A component that highlights and magnifies specific areas of an image or interface, allowing users to focus on details or access additional information about particular elements.
A visual symbol or graphic that represents an action, object, or concept, available in various sizes and styles to enhance visual communication and user interface clarity.
A button component that uses an icon as its primary visual element, providing a compact and intuitive way to represent actions or navigation options with visual clarity.
A component that displays custom artwork or graphics, often used to enhance visual appeal, explain concepts, or provide visual context for content and features.
A component that displays and manages images, with options for different aspect ratios, loading states, captions, and interactive features like zoom or gallery views.
A small icon component that provides access to additional information or help content, typically appearing as a question mark or information symbol that reveals details on interaction.
A small popup component that provides contextual information or guidance, appearing when users hover over or focus on an element to explain its purpose or usage.
A component that allows users to edit content directly in its display context, transforming static text into editable fields when activated, with options for different input types and validation.
A form control that allows users to enter and edit text or data, with various types and validation options to ensure proper input format.
A component for user interface interaction.

A component that displays a collection of items in a structured format, with options for different list styles, item selection, and interactive features for data manipulation.
A component that indicates an ongoing process or loading state, available in various styles like spinners, progress bars, or skeleton screens to provide visual feedback.

A component that provides access to different sections or pages of an application, available in various layouts and styles to accommodate different navigation patterns and hierarchies.
A component that displays temporary messages to inform users about system status, updates, or important information, with options for different styles and auto-dismissal.

A component that allows users to provide or view ratings, typically using stars or other visual indicators, with options for different rating scales and display styles.
A component that provides a text editing interface with formatting options, allowing users to create and edit rich text content with various styling and formatting capabilities.

A structured component that displays data in rows and columns, with support for sorting, filtering, pagination, and various interactive features for data manipulation.
